Loung walks into the living room where her brother KIM, t listening to music on a record player. His records and co are spread out all over the floor. Like all older brother likes to give his little sisters trouble. Loung reaches for the crickets (or colorful fruit) he is eating. He chops at her arm kung fu style. He does a huan (monkey king) kick. (Possibly in PaвЂ™s helmet) CHOU helps with Geak. Loung looks up at KHOUY and MENG her eldest brothers who just walked in the door. Meng greets her with a smile and musses her hair. He is gentle and soft spoken like Pa. Kh is cool with his sunglasses and long hair. (Maybe he brin something to Kim or tried out a new record.)

Everyone sits at the table. Set with elegance. Ma and KEA LoungвЂ™s beautiful older sister, help serve the food. Lo watches their hands. So delicate. Their grace and poise i mystery to her. CLOSE UP - LoungвЂ™s POV of food. Loung drops two whole in her soup and Pa looks on approvingly. She crushes the peppers against the side of her bowl with a spoon. Loung likes the smile he gives her; so she again reach he chopsticks toward the pepper dish, knocking over the salt shaker, which rolls like a fallen log onto the floor. Ma seems upset but Pa smiles forgivingly. What Loung love most about Pa is the way he smiles not only with his mout but also with his eyes. Loung always restless, kicking her feet under the table.
Keav helps to get Loung, Chou and Geak ready for bed. Lou in her pyjamas being told to stop jumping on the bed. (details - again important to feel her life before war)

{NOTE: This sequence will begin with the arrival of LON N (Government) troops entering the city believing that a tr has been agreed. } At the beginning, the first to enter the city were the Lo Nol soldiers, they put the guns down and they raised whit flags and people applauded because it was for them the en the war and the end of bloody fighting in the city. Later the Khmer Rouge soldiers entered with closed expressions their faces. They did not talk to anyone. Most of the Khm Rouge entered the city by walking, to secure the streets. Their chiefs were riding in jeeps but very few. Some were driving motorbikes. It is the high heat of the afternoon. Loung plays hopscot with Chou and their friends on the street in front of the flat. Sounds of giggles are taken over by the thunder of engine the distance. Everyone stops what they are doing and watc the tanks roar into the city. The Lon Nol soldiers waving white flags. Smiling. People cheer. Then Loung sees something else coming. Trucks. Minutes later, the mud-covered old trucks heave and bounc they pass slowly in front of Loung. Green, gray and black these cargo trucks sway back and forth on bald tires, spitting out dirt and engine smoke as they roll on. In the back of the trucks, men wearing faded black long and long-sleeve black shirts, many with tire shoes and wi red sashes cinched tightly around their waists and red scarves tied around their foreheads, stand body to body. look young and all are dark-skinned, like the peasant workers. With long rifles in their arms or strapped across their backs, they look over the crowds the way the king does wh he passes by. There is no cheering for them. Loung waves at the soldiers even though she doesnвЂ™t kno exactly why. She sees more trucks coming.
Loung runs up to the apartment stairs. Her little legs ru fast as they can but the stairs feel like they go on fore
Loung finds Pa on the balcony with Meng and Kim. They see tense. She watches them.

My brothers, we must avoid any effusion of blood. Put your guns down. We will negotiate with our brothers from the other side. We are all Khmer. We all love our country, our nation. We will... A KR takes the megaphone brutally.

Angkar has won throughout the country over the Khmer Republic. Lon Nol are traitors. Angkar need not negotiate with anyone or any group. The traitors must accept defeat. Give up your guns. There will be no negotiation The Clique of Lon Nol soldiers form a group. KHMER ROUGE WITH MEGAPHONE (CONTвЂ™D) America will bomb the city. You must leave now! Take as little as you can. No one can stay here. (MORE )

KHMER ROUGE WITH MEGAPHONE (CONTвЂ™D) The United States will bomb the city! Leave and stay in the countryside for three days! Loung doesnвЂ™t understand. Loung stares at a man holding a megaphone standing on a j A KR soldier fires shots to open a door and clear out a building. Loung claps her hands over her ears and hides h face against KeavвЂ™s chest. People push and shove one an in a frenzy. Ma now standing behind Loung has heard.
Loung quickly, go eat your lunch.

Loung goes into the kitchen. Her lunch is waiting for her Everyone else has already eaten. She sits and eats. After a few minutes, Ma rushes into the kitchen with Keav begins to toss aluminum bowls, plates, spoons, forks, and knives into a big pot. The silverware clangs noisily, mak Loung jittery. Then picking up a cloth bag, she throws ba of sugar, salt, dried fish, uncooked rice, and canned foo into it.
We will be leaving for a few days. Gather your things.
But Ma?
Gather your things. Loung shovels down a few more bites and gets up.

Loung follows Ma into the bedroom where she sees her and sewing jewelry into a jacket lining. She then moves from the bedroom to the living room, taki pictures of her family and the Buddha off the walls and piling them into her arms. In the bathroom, Kim throws soap, shampoo, towels, and ot assorted items into a pillowcase.
(to Loung) Are you finished yet? Loung nods вЂњnoвЂќ.
Hurry and change your shirt. The one youвЂ™re wearing is dirty. INT. PHNOM PENH APARTMENT LOUNGвЂ™S ROOM - DAY

Loung pokes her head into her bedroom and spies Chou shov clothes into a bag. On the bed, Geak sits quietly playing with a handheld mirror while Chou throws our brushes, com and hairpins into her school bag. Loung goes through her clothes and picks a yellow shirt. is packing her red dress. Loung remembers to pack her matching one.

The family head out of the apartment. The chaos of the ci People push and shove one another to evacuate the city. Everywhere, people are on the move. Little children cry. Women and men carry their belongings in cloth bags on the backs and their heads. They walk with short, brisk steps, demanding their children stay together, to hold each othe hands, to not get left behind. A lone radio has been abandoned in the chaos. Loung liste to the song as she passes. Loung moves to the Mazda parked outside but she is pulled away from it and towards the old family truck in the back The family pile into the truck. The old pickup truck crea and squeaks as Khouy throws a cloth bag and water can ont its floor. In front, Pa ties a large white cloth to the antenna while Meng ties another piece to the side mirrors
The traffic is moving very slowly. Loung looks out. Their truck inches on in the streets, allowing them a safe view of the scene.

Families on the move. Chaos. The KR soldiers are everywhe There are so many of them around, giving orders into thei bullhorns cradling rifles in their arms. Loung notices the other children. The fear on their faces Small mountains of guns fill the sidewalk as government soldiers turn over their weapons to the men in black. The soldiers are then put into a truck and driven off. Loung buries her face into Keav's chest, her arms tight around her waist. Chou sits silently on the other side of Keav, her eyes shut. Beside them, Khouy and Meng sit ston faced, watching the exodus. Later - Loung burrows under her scarf to hide from the su Her eye lids struggle to stay open. Her POV of her hair whiping about her face. The sun shining on it. Keav wraps end of Loungs scarf over her mouth an nostrils to keep th dust out.

DonвЂ™t look over the truck. Keep your head down. Loung pretends to follow her sisters orders but peeks ove the edge. Loung sees a doctor assisting a pregnant woman out of the hospital. A KR soldier telling the doctor to evacuate peo more quickly. The doctor begs him. He moves him aside and guides staff and patients out with his rifle. She sees a hospital evacuated. Some people being pushed in carts or hospital beds by their relatives. Soldiers in black knocking on doors with their gun buts a evacuating people from their homes.
High wide shot of the chaos of the city. The truck slowly makes itвЂ™s way through the crowded streets.

As they move further from the city, the high rise apartme disappear and thatched-roofed huts take their place. The paved boulevard gives way to dusty roads. Tall elephant g and prickly brown bushes have replaced the tall trees. As far as Loung can see, there are people marching in the roads while huts stand empty and rice field are left unattended. (See some areas affected by bombing - possibl one or two plate shots)
The sun is setting. The masses silhouetted as they contin along the road.

Hours later - the truck pulls over. The fields are lit up with small fires illuminating the f of the women squatting near them, preparing meals. Loung looks around. In the darkness she can still make out thousands of people milling around, or walking to unknown destinations. Others, like them have stopped to rest for night along the roadside. Later вЂ” Ma and Keav prepare the meal from the food Ma had packed. Chou is brushing GeakвЂ™s hair, being careful not to pull They squat in the darkness eating their food. (discuss Ma trading jewels for items or food)

Loung is tucked in by Ma in the back of the truck. While Loung, Chou and Geak sleep in the bed of the truck, the o kids sleep on the ground with Pa. ItвЂ™s a warm breezy ni the kind that requires no blankets. Loung canвЂ™t sleep. She looks up at the vastness of the The dark sky is full of shining bright stars. Some blink her. She winks back and closes her eyes.

Loung opens her eyes to find her family is already packin up. They look tired with their hair sticking out in all directions. Someone is yelling. Loung looks around. A group of Khmer Rouge soldiers are yelling at everyone to keep moving. Lo stares at their guns. Meng helps her up and gives her comfort. The KR soldier signals for Pa to move away from the truck Pa steps out.
You comrade! The Angkar needs your truck. You no longer will need it. Loung looks to Pa for his response. He simply lowers his eyes and nods.
(softly to his family) Everyone grab what you can carry. Loung watches as her siblings begin to pack.
Comrade! Angkar needs your watch!

Certainly. Loung watches as PaвЂ™s shoulders bend forward in submiss He takes the watch off his wrist. Pa does not look the soldier in the eyes as he hands over the watch. Loung watches as a YOUNG KR walks up to Meng and Khouy. H smiles at them. A strange smile as he takes their watches He gives Keav a look.  10A. The soldiers look at PaвЂ™s watch with suspicion.
This is very nice. Who are you to have such a nice watch?
It was a gift from my boss.

Content from Scene 42 and 43 merged into Scene 45. Content from Scene 44 merged into Scene 41.  11.

The sun is hot on LoungвЂ™s back. It burns through her bl hair. She looks at Chou and sees beads of sweat collect along her hair line and upper lip. Everywhere they go people are walking in all directions carrying their belongings. Soldiers with guns move them along. They walk from the break of day until the dark of the evening. Loung Looks at her fingers and holds up one fing then two.

Ma and Pa guides the children to an area roadside where t sit in silence and eat the dried fish they had packed. Ma a small pot of sugar (OR BUYS IT FROM A FAMILY) They all a taste of it. Loung rolls it in her fingers and licks ev last bit. Later - Ma is cutting off KhouyвЂ™s long hair.  12. Loung sees her father walking off on his own. She follows with her eyes. He finds a secret place in the shade, behi tree, and goes to his knees. Loung moves closer. She sees he is digging a hole. A mome later he pulls his ID cards and his work ties and buries them. She doesnвЂ™t understand and moves quickly back so he doe see her. Gone is the air of mystery and excitement; now Luong is simply afraid.

Along the road, the bombed buildings, the scars of war. ItвЂ™s the third day on the road. Loung walks with a litt more bounce in her step. She looks at her fingers and hol up two then three. She makes her way up to Pa.
Pa, the soldiers said we can return home after three days. Loung tugs at PaвЂ™s trousers.
No, Loung.
But itвЂ™s the third day.
(sadly) We have to keep walking.
Pa, IвЂ™m hungry and my feet hurt. Loung stops walking. She stands still on the road and let of the rice pot to wipe the dirt and tears from her cheek

LetвЂ™s go home. I just want to go home.  13. The red dust from the road and the sweat on her little bo have mixed to create a layer of mud on her skin, making i dry and itchy. Pa walks over to Keav and takes a ball of sticky rice out the pot she is carrying. He walks back to Loung and hands the food. Her eyes look down at the ground in shame but s takes the food anyway. Silently, he strokes her hair whil she eats the rice between the chocking sobs. Pa bends down and looks Loung in the eyes.
We cannot go home tonight.
But they said three days.

We have to keep walking. Reluctantly, Loung does what Pa tells her. Everybody has carry something, so she pick the smallest item in the pil the rice pot. As she walks, the pot becomes heavier and heavier in her hands as the sun climbs higher and higher in the sky. The metal handle digs and burns the palms of her hands. Somet she carries it with two hands in front of her, other time she switches the pot from her right to her left arm, but seems no matter how she carries it the pot painfully bang into some part of her leg. Later- Loung is losing hope that they can go home tonight Tired and hungry, she drags her feet, taking smaller and smaller steps until she is far behind everyone else. Pa gently walks over and cleans her face with his hand. H then takes the rice pot and carries it for her. With Geak on her hip, Ma walks over to Loung and wraps a scarf around her head to protect her from the sun. As she walks on Loung watches Geak in her arms. He feet dangling MaвЂ™s hip. Loung wishes she was a baby and could be carr She sees many people around her that are worse off than herself. Hours later- As the hot sun beats down on them, the family continues t walk. - for the landscape : On the road from Phnom Penh to Kam Baul, there is very little forest.  14. - KR soldiers do not have their arms across their back. T have AK47 that they carry on the side or in front of them (See photos archives). - most of the time, the KR cadres, the kamapibal, who man evacuation, have no arms. Or maybe just a handgun. - along the road of evacuation, there are KR patrols Loung watches as a woman breast feeds her baby wrapped to chest as she walks. Loung sees a KR soldier. She quickly turns her face away walks to catch up with Pa. Loung studies the face of the father then quickly turns h face away and walks to catch up with Pa.

By noontime they have reached the Khmer Rouge's military check-point. The checkpoint consists of no more than a fe small makeshift tents with trucks parked beside them. The are many soldiers at this base, and it is easy to recogni them because they wear identical loose-fitting black paja pants and shirts. Even the female KR have very distinct h cuts. All carry identical guns slung across their backs. move quickly from place to place with fingers on the trig of their weapons, pacing back and forth in front of the crowd, giving instructions into a bullhorn.
You are not allowed to pass until we have cleared you. Stand with your family in a line. The Commander continues.

Anyone who has worked as a public servant, official, police, or military, step up to the right table to register for work. Loung glances at Pa then looks quickly away. She feels si Pa gathers their family and stands them in a line with th other peasant farmers.

(whispering) Remember, we are workers. Give these men whatever they want and donвЂ™t argue.  15. In front of them, the line splits in two as a large group ex-soldiers, government workers, and former politicians w over to the table to register for work. LoungвЂ™s heart p quickly against her chest, but she says nothing and leans against Pa's legs. He reaches down and puts his hand on t of her head. It stays there as if protecting her from the and the soldiers. After a few minutes, her head feels coo and her heartbeat slows. (Artists with long hair and poss a guitar are taken away ) A KR soldier opens a bag of another family discovering a bundle of money.

You do not need this. (Holding the money) There are no longer any rich, there are no longer any poor. Let us all live in equality! Ahead of them in the line, Khmer Rouge soldiers tells something to the crowd, but Loung cannot understand all o what they say. KR CHECKPOINT SOLDIER (CONTвЂ™D) When the Angkar questions you, answer loyally. Then one Khmer Rouge soldier roughly jerks a bag off of o man's shoulder and dumps its contents on the ground. From this pile, a Khmer Rouge soldier picks up an old Lon Nol uniform. The Khmer Rouge soldier sneers at the man and pu him to another Khmer Rouge soldier standing beside him. T soldier then moves on to the next family. Eyes downcast, shoulders slumped, arms hanging loosely on both sides of the man with the Lon Nol uniform in his bag does not figh another Khmer Rouge soldier points and pushes him away wi the butt of his rifle. Loung feels the heat of the sun move down her back. We no the shadows moving. Hours have gone by. A Khmer Rouge soldier approaches them, Loung leans closer Pa and reaches up for his hand. Pa's hand is much too big hers, so She is only able to wrap her fingers around his index finger.
What do you do?
I work as a packer in the shipping port.  16.
(to Ma) And you, what do you do? Loung notices MaвЂ™s eyes focus on the ground and she shi GeakвЂ™s weight on her hips.

I sell old clothes in the market. The soldier rummages through all their bags one by one. He takes money and KimвЂ™s comic books. (Discuss what els would be taken) He takes the red dresses Loung and Chou had packed. Loung follows the dress with her eyes, focusing all her energy on it, wanting desperately to rescue it. Her first red dress, the one Ma made for her for the New Year's celebration. MEMORY-вЂ”

Flashes of color - Loung remembers Ma taking her measurements, holding the soft chiffon cloth against her body, and asking her if she liked it. Ma smiles at Loung pleased with how pretty the color looks on her. Loung see herself in the mirror.

Then he bends down and lifts the lid of the rice pot next Pa's feet. Gripping Pa's finger even tighter, LoungвЂ™s h races as the soldier checks the pot. His face is close to hers; she concentrates on her dirty toes. She dare not lo into his eyes. She peaks. She looks right at him.
All right, you are cleared. You may go.
(meekly) Thank you comrade. The soldier is already looking past Pa and merely waves h hand for them to hurry on.  17.
Passing the checkpoint safely, they walk on. A few miles the road the sound of gunshots ring out in the distance behind Loung. She watches as a flock of black birds explo into the sky.
Later - As she walks, Loung watches as the sun goes to sl behind the mountains and the world becomes a place of sha and shapes once again. Sees a body in the field. He wears uniform like PaвЂ™s.

In the mass of people, Pa finds them a spot of unoccupied grass near the side of the road. Loung and Chou walk around and find a pond full of lotus flowers. Kim finds a small area full of fish. The childre as children do, explore the area. Later - Ma puts Geak down next to Loung and tells her to an eye on her. Sitting next to her, Loung is struck by ho Geak looks. Breathing quietly, she fights to keep her eye open, but in the end she loses and falls to sleep. Loung her arm around her sister in a protective way. She lies d on a small bundle of clothes. Quickly, Loung also falls asleep.

In her dream, fireworks crackle and boom noisily, she rejoices in the New Year celebration. Everything is red. Chinese firecrackers explode. Smoke rises. Confetti paper falls onto LoungвЂ™s face as she runs through the bits of and white smoke. LOUNGвЂ™S DREAM ENDS

Fireworks from the dream turn into gunshots in the distan Loung wakes up the next morning to the voices of her brot and father whispering to each other about what went on in night. She canвЂ™t hear but they look concerned.  18. Keav takes her hand, grabs her things and leads her on.

LoungвЂ™s POV - Pa carrying Geak and reassuring Kim. People see along the road the scars of war. Loung feels Keav's hand pull at her, and her feet automatically move in her sisters direction. With LoungвЂ hand in hers, they catch up with the rest of the family a continue their fourth day of marching.

On their walk, the soldiers are everywhere, prodding them along. They point and give directions with their guns. In the scorching April heat, Loung watches as many older people become ill from heatstroke and dehydration, althou they dare not rest. When someone falls ill, the family th out his belongings, puts the sick person on someone's bac and march on. Loung notices a few lifeless bodies laid in a row on the of the road. She focuses on their feet. The road ahead of them shimmers in the heat, and the dust swells are everywhere, burning LoungвЂ™s eyes. In the distance, her eyes focus on a lone man with a wago pulled by two yellow skinny cows. It is strange that he i traveling against the flow of traffic. All of a sudden, s is startled by Ma's scream. Between loud, halting sobs Ma manages to say-

ItвЂ™s you Uncle Leang! With their hands in the air and bodies jumping up and dow they wave excitedly to their uncle. UNCLE LEANG waves one hand back and moves his ox cart in their direction. He co to a stop a few feet from them, and all at once they rush toward him. He takes Ma into his arms with Pa standing quietly beside them. Uncle Leang hands Ma a package from the cart, she opens t package of food, sweet rice, fish and bamboo sticks.

IвЂ™ve been looking for you since I heard.  19. Standing next to Uncle Leang, Loung has to tilt her head as far as she can to see his face because he is so tall. she can see is the shape of his thin lips and wide, black nostrils that flare once every few seconds as he talks to At almost six feet tall, second Uncle Kim Leang hovers ab all of them.

While Pa and Ma talk to LoungвЂ™s uncle, Loung quickly cl seat in the wagon with Chou and Geak. She stares at the skinny cows. She wonders if they are strong enough to be to pull the family. Only young children can be on the wagon with the uncle.

As the sun begins to set. Their trail takes them on a gra road along Route 26 westward. No matter where they go or which direction they turn, there are people marching ahea and behind them. In the midst of the crowd, Their wagon passes a Khmer Rouge village without stopping Houses on stilts and men in black with checkered scarfs. of their children are in the bright green fields catching fish with rods. Further down the road Loung sees a pagoda with KR soldier holding men prisoner. Beyond them in the distance she see soldiers watching as Monks are made to tend the fields. L looks at the faces of the Monks. They are put to work as they are being punished. She feels sad for them. The cattle wagon keeps moving. They veer westward, leaving their roadside companions far behind. Later- Somewhere between Bat Deng and Krang Truop, Loung falls asleep. HER POV GOES OUT OF FOCUS.  20.

Loung slowly opens her eyes. Five days after leaving thei home in Phnom Penh, the family arrives at Krang Truop. A small dusty village surrounded by rice fields as far as t eye can see. INT. UNCLE LEANGвЂ™S HUT - MORNING Loung enters Uncle LeangвЂ™s hut. Uncle Leang and his wif six children, so with the nine new people it makes sevent under one roof. There are objects that show Uncle Leang h been a middle class farmer before the Khmer Rouge took ov Loung climbs into PaвЂ™s arms.
The village is so poor.

(strong) So are we. And from now on if anyone asks, we say we are workers. We can not go back to the city. You must stop thinking we can go back. Pa has never spoken to her this way. It finally sinks in. trembles with fear. He holds her in his arms as her eyes water and her lips tremble. EXT./INT. UNCLE LEANGвЂ™S HUT - DAY LoungвЂ™s POV of the rice fields. She removes her clothes hands them to Chou who is already washed and in a sarong. Loung washes herself outside. There is a big round contai that looks like a three-foot-tall clay flowerpot. Then sh reaches into the container and takes a bowl full of water pours it over herself. She becomes shy when she sees her little cousins watching her. EXT. UNCLE LEANGвЂ™S HUT - DAY The family clothes hang to dry. Pa helps Uncle repair a f trap. He is clumsy because he does not know how to do it properly. They share a hot tea and smoke tobacco. A NEIGH is with them.  20A.
Is it true everyone has evacuated Phnom Phen? (Pa nods) Did the Americans bomb the city?
Angkar asked us to leave. I heard no bombings.
Here, in the village, Americans have bombed for many years. Sometimes three days in a row. We had to harvest during the night.  21. He pauses deep in thought.

They destroyed my house. My cows. I now support the Khmer Rouge revolution. We want a new society, without poor people, without rich people. We donвЂ™t need the capitalists. The land is ours. We are masters of earth and water. Nobody answers.

If you stay here you must refer to the village chief. You are from the city. You must be careful. Angkar knows everything. EXT. UNCLE LEANGвЂ™S HUT - DAY Loung wanders away towards a group of kids having a beetl fight. Geak is loving it. Chou is not so sure. Kim and Meng and Khouy play around doing handstands, and teaching their cousins. Ma and Keave are with the other women. INT. UNCLE LEANGвЂ™S HUT - NIGHT Lying on wooden planks Loung watches Chou tossing and turning. Ma sits on a mat nearby holding Geak, who sleeps quietly in her arms. She looks around the room at her sleeping family. Loung overhears a discussion underneath floorboards. She looks through the slats.

They both know it means when the soldiers come to the village and take someone with them. Loung stares into the empty hut. They cannot have survive three years of starvation and the loss of Keav and Pa onl be taken now! She fought so hard to live! She cannot be g Poor little Geak, she never got anything good out of life At the sound of a baby, DaviвЂ™s mother leaves.

MEMORY of Ma singing her to sleep in Phnom Penh flashes before Loung. She cannot be strong anymore. Tears run uncontrollably do her face. Her chest compresses, her insides gnaw at her, eating away at her sanity. She has to run away, she has t leave. Somehow her legs take over and carry her away from village. Her body goes weak when she wonders which one th soldiers killed first...

head_text.subj: HER MIND PROJECTS IMAGES OF THE TWO OF THEM TOGETHER. HER
THOUGHTS OF WHAT MIGHT HAVE HAPPENED -

text: Ma cries softly, her body tense with fear.  70. Suddenly the rattling sounds of the rifles go off and bul pierce through bodies, silencing their screams. Geak moves to Ma's slumped-over body with her face in the mud. Geak is too young to understand what has just happen She calls Ma. She touches Ma's cheeks and ears, and grabs hair to try to lift her face out of the mud, but she is n strong enough. While rubbing her eyes, she wipes Ma's blo all over her own face. She pounds her fists on Ma's back, trying to wake her up, but Ma is gone. Holding on to Ma's head, Geak screams and screams, not stopping to take in a air. Seconds later, a shot, Geak too is silenced.

Loung walks away from Ro Leap deafened by the ringing in ears. Tears pour from her as she drags herself away from the village. Her eyes flutter, it is as if she is drifting aw into another place, into the deepest recesses of her mind hide from the pain. Suddenly, the world becomes hazy and blurry. It is black all around her, soothing and empty.
Staring straight ahead, Loung regains conscious thought. Slap. She is back at camp, standing before Met Srei. Her massages her stinging cheek; she tastes blood in her mout
(demanding) Where have you been? For Loung, the world comes back into focus. He looks at t girls standing around staring.
I went to see my sister.
And stayed there for three days? LoungвЂ™s eyes widen in disbelief.
I donвЂ™t know. I donвЂ™t know where I was.  71. Met Srei slaps her again. Loung almost loses her balance. Srei screams into her face.

You wonвЂ™t tell me? No food tonight and I will reduce your ration until you do. Met Srei walks away. After she is gone, Loung walks to th well and pull up a pail of water. Drinking some, pouring rest over her feet. Rubbing one foot against the other, s removes the layers of red mud to expose her small, wrinkl toes.

Remaining boys practice bokotor. Early morning Met Srei takes her old clothes and stuffs t with leaves and straw to make dummies. The heads, she stu her red checkered scarf with straw. She then lines up the girls single file across from the dummies. With a six-inch knife in hand, Loung stands at attention. Panting like an animal, with her legs shaking and her han gripping the knife, Loung attacks at Met SreiвЂ™s cue, ch at her dummy. Though she is focused on its head, Loung is only tall enough to thrust her knife into its stomach. She stabs it over and over again. Now she no longer has to pretend to be an orphan.

Wide of the fields. Mounds of earth. It appears empty. Suddenly muddy girls rise up from their hiding places and forward. Each holding a pointed stick in their hands. (possibly a few sticks to lay like traps) Loung runs through the middy fields. She is covered in mu She is fast. Angry. She pushes another little girl to the ground. She runs drops to her belly and crawls as if possessed.
Hugging her rifle to her chest, Met Srei paces back and forth.  72.

They will kill you if they catch you. You must protect yourself in anyway you can. Long live the glorious Cambodian revolution! Long live the great people of Kampuchea. Fists in the air. Loung with ferocity. She seems older. Something in her face has changed.
Cheyo! Cheyo! Cheyo!

That night none of the girls can sleep as they listen to explosions of mortars and rockets in the distance. After few hours of shelling, all is quiet again. Then without warning, a mortar explodes near their base, blazing the sky white like lightning. Loung screams and covers her ears with her hands just as another mortar whistles and hits the camp. Trees burst into flame. Screa and wailing, the girls try to escape before fire consumes them. The girls run and crawl away, their faces black fro smoke and their eyes white with terror. Many are dripping blood from their arms and legs where shrapnel sliced thro their skin. Loung heads away as the fire spreads everywhere. GIRLвЂ™S VOICE DonвЂ™t leave me! IвЂ™m hit! Help me! Loung looks to see a girl lying in a pool of blood. Propp herself up on her elbow, she begs for help. She is shakin and shivering. The other girls do not stop. Seeing Loung looking at her, she holds out a bloody hand to her. Fire spreads through the camp quickly, debris falling everywhe Loung is much smaller than the girl. Loung screams and co her ears as another mortar explodes nearby. Panicked, she turns her back on the girl and runs away. The girl continues to scream long anguished cries as flam engulf the camp. All the girls head off in different directions in a despe bid to escape the camp. In the dark, the straw walls and roofs combust into yellow and orange flames, illuminating red faces of girls running away.  73.

On the road, Loung finds herself crowded among hundreds o people walking amid deserted towns and villages. Automatically, her body takes control of her feet and vee her in the direction of her ChouвЂ™s camp. EXT. CHILDRENвЂ™S WORK CAMP - NIGHT The camp is dark and empty when Loung get there.
(desperate) Chou! Chou! Loung circles around the compound, but Chou is not there. camp has been evacuated. Penned animals panic as fire surrounds them.

Loung runs back out into the traffic, not knowing what to next. All around her the people move like a herd of cows. Not knowing what to do. She is afraid. She feels a hand grab her shoulder. It's Kim. He's alive! Chou is with him, holding on tight to his hand. LoungвЂ™s been so happy!

Come, we have to leave quickly. Kim grabs LoungвЂ™s hand and they head back onto the road into the traffic. Kim is once again in charge of the family. As other peopl carry their pots, pans, clothes, food, and other belongin on their backs or in their wagons, Kim carries a backpack with a few clothes in it, while Chou and Loung hold his h and walk with only the clothes they are wearing.

They walk with the sea of people, following their route. Loung leans on Kim. Soon the sun rises. In crimson red, golden yellow, and fiery orange, it lights up the world around them. In the field, tall elephant grass glistens w morning dew while gray smoke floats in to the sky from distant villages. The small red gravel roads are swarmed body to body with people in their black shirts and pants.  74. The traffic does not stop and continues to move, everybod dragging their feet slower and slower. Those who cannot m any farther sit at the side of the road, some curl up ina fetal position and sleep. The snakelike traffic pushes on with the strong able-bodied men forming the head, and the old, young, weak, and hungry trailing behind as the tail.
As the sun climbs higher in the sky. Kim spots a deserted bombed house. Chou and Loung follow Kim's lead.

Alone in the bombed house, all is quiet except for the muffled grunts of pigs and cackles of chicken. The villag evacuated in such a hurry that they left clothes, sandals and scarves strewn everywhere on the ground. In the commu kitchen, smoke still rises from the ashes. Chou enters a and comes out with a few metal pots, aluminum bowls, and remaining few small bags of rice and salt. Loung grabs th scarves, (or pieces like a jacket for Kim or a scarf for her?). Loung makes a big bundle with a scarf to balance o her head. Chou does the same. Loung watches as Kim catch two chickens and locks their w behind their backs. He kills them and hangs them to carry (could be just one and may carry live)

Bundles in hand, they walk back out to join the mob of people. Not knowing where they are going, they follow the traffic. Kim notices something on the road. He points it to the girls. An anti tank mine. Half buried on the road. Loung looks at it as she carefully walks around it. Later - they pass a land mine that has exploded. Nothing a hole in the ground and the remains of the blood from th victim who was dragged away. Now she is constantly lookin down at the road. Terrified. There is gunfire in the distance.  75.

Loung stops and stares straight ahead. Her heart pounds so loudly. Before them walk three men dressed in green clothes. Their legs move in long, casual strides and their rifles swing on their back. вЂњYouns,вЂ traffic hums and whispers. Loung is surprised as she was they are like monsters. In fact they are the same size as Khmer men and are similarly built. They do not look like devils Met Srei said they were. The Vietnamese walk toward them and raise their hands in greeting. Loung searches the ground for weapons - a staff sharp rocks, anything she can use to fight them. All eyes focus on them as they come nearer. People gasp when, in t next moment, one Vietnamese smiles.

(in broken Khemer ) Chum reap sour. (hello) There is a rest area ahead in Pursat City. At last, they have a destination. Loung, Kim and Chou carefully walk past the soldier. Still not feeling completely safe around him. They walk on.

Loung sees the area. It looms like a small village before them, flickering and swaying in the haze like a mirage. Many people are very thin. Those who were not in labor or soldier camps are near dead. Next to the tents, women prepare food (caught snake, frog or chicken) , blowing and stoking the fires, coughing as smoke finds their faces. The Vietnamese are all around, weaving through the labyri and patrolling the area with rifles on their shoulders an grenades attached to their belts. Kim pulls at LoungвЂ™s arm and gestures for her to hurry begins to fall behind. They pass through the crowd, searc for an empty spot to make their home. Kim, Loung, and Chou settle under a tree at the edge of t area with a few other ORPHANS.  76.
Loung Kim and Chou pluck the chickens.

Finally Chou announces they are done. Kim breaks off a le scoops up a bowl of rice, and hands it to Loung. With the plates in front of them, they eat in silence. They notice a couple Orphans staring. Chou whispers to Ki and he invites them to share what little chicken they hav

A day in the area - add details. Chou and Loung preparing snake (with a knife they found at the abandoned house). K prepares a fire. Survival. Some cooking frogs or spiders. Some people dying, having been starved too long. Later- Kim brings over a small water bucket. Kim, Chou and Loung help each other clean up. Chou wipes mud off LoungвЂ™s fa She then runs her fingers through her hair to вЂњbrushвЂќ Chou then walks up to Kim and pulls stray threads from hi shirt.

Chou spreads out their scarfs and lies down. With her in middle, Kim and Loung huddle closely on either side of he Kim hooks a bundle through his arms while Loung does the to her bundle. They pull (Kims new jacket?) over themselv All around them people are sleeping, eating, or sitting quietly together. Many who have little strength left are assisting the sick. Loung looks over to the side and watc a family sitting together, eating their meal. It is a fam of five, parents with three boys, from perhaps five to te years old. The father scoops rice and hands it over to hi youngest child first, then he does the same for the other The mother reaches over and wipes the child's nose with h fingers, then quickly wipes her hand on her skirt. Loung looks at the fathers kind eyes. She sees how much he love his family. She misses Pa.  76A. Loung turns away. Gunfire can be heard in the distance.  77.
Loung and Chou wash and hang their laundry.

Flashes - New Year's morning, Keav, with big pink, yellow blue, and green prickly plastic rollers in her hair held by a hundred small black bobby pins sticking up everywher like porcupine quills, as she combs LoungвЂ™s hair and ti in ponytails. Next to her on the bed, Chou works on getti Geak dressed. After Keav finishes with LoungвЂ™s hair, sh red rouge on Geak's lips and cheeks. On their bed, they bounce with glee as their mattress squeaks. Colors and pretty clothes and laughter.
An ax chops wood-

Loung, Kim and Chou gather firewood. Loung steps on somet that looks like a brown twig but it slithers away giving a small fright. Loung rubs her tired eyes, yawns, and adjusts the ropes s brought to tie the firewood, slinging them over her shoulders. Chou walks ahead with the ax in her arms.
The sounds of morning. The mass of small makeshift settlements for displaced families are all silent. Men in green patrol the area.  78.

Suddenly Loung awakens to the sound of a loud explosion. bolts upright, her ears ringing from the blast. She hears shrilling whine before another rocket ruptures nearby. Th children scream at the top of their lungs, clambering aro the campsite. Loung, Chou, Kim and the Orphans move.

The earth shakes violently as crackling yellow, orange, a red flames devour a nearby hut. Gray smoke floats to the and white ashes fall on them like powder. (if no hut then embers from a blast. To be discussed) Loung watches as all around her people cry and scream for help as more rockets rain on the village. Fire engulfs th camp and villagers rush to evacuate.

Loung sees the men in green fighting the KR soldiers. Bot sides seem equally frightening to her. Loung gets separated. She looks around everyone looks the same. She canвЂ™t find Kim and Chou. She feels panicked. Finally, she finds them. With their legs shaking in fear, they follow Kim ducking and keeping low.

They come to the river and, holding hands, wade into it. river splashes in waves as hundreds of people jump in it once trying to get to the other side. With small bundles their heads or draped on their shoulders and small childr hanging on their backs, the villagers wade across the che deep stream, desperately reaching for safety. Loung Kim a Chou tuck in to the side of the river bank to avoid the battle that rages around them. RE IMAGE AJP. She sees a young KR fighting the Vietnamese. ItвЂ™s Smili Boy. A blast almost knocks the air out from LoungвЂ™s lungs. S reaches for the Orphan boyвЂ™s arm, then jerks her hand b her palm touches something wet and sticky on her.  79. Her stomach churns. Loung turns to see him lying facedown the ground, quiet and motionless. His little brother belo him covered in blood. The top of his skull is caved in. A pool of blood slowly seeps into the dirt around her head. Blood and pieces of brain are on LoungвЂ™s hand.
The battle rages on. Loung, Chou and Kim are under fire a forced to run.

People are scattered everywhere, soaking wet screaming an crying as they run in every direction, bumping and pushin each other. Kim and Chou hold hands and run ahead of Loun yelling for her to keep up. They don't know where to run they just run.

Running as fast as she can, Loung jumps over dead bodies. hears their bullets whiz past her. She runs for her life. front of her, a man falls from a bullet. His body stops m stride, his chest jerking forward before he falls to the ground. Many people get hit and drop one by one to the gr all around her. Some lie still while others crawl on thei elbows trying to reach safety. Loung sees a man thrown into the air as the ground explod beneath him. Land mines. She keeps running. A woman with child stands screaming. Another woman running knocks into and the ground beneath them explodes. Loung runs staring the ground. What can she do? Bullets from behind, land mi underneath. She holds her breath and moves forward. (Poss moves forward slowly because of mines. Could discuss slow motion as world blows up around her and her heart beats) Minutes later- After she catches up with Chou and Kim, they see an old remnant of a tree stump. It sticks out of the ground thre feet tall by four feet wide. They crouch behind it.  80.

Chou covers her ears with her hands and squeezes her eyes shut. Kim is white, leaning against the tree for support. They stay there for what seems like hours until all is qu again. Later- When they believe it is safe, they come out from behind t tree stump. Loung watches Chou and Kim trudge ahead, their eyes focus on the ground. There are smoldering remains of bonfires giving off the stench of burnt human flesh all through the village. Trai and puddles of blood stain the area. Her eyes are on the ground wherever she goes, steering clear of anything that looks like a grenade or land mine. They try to step into footprints of others.
A month or so later. They have moved with others up to a mountainous region where it is safe. Chou and Loung at th river. Life is returning. We can see that aid relief is beginning to trickle in.
Kim arrives at the site all flushed and out of breath. As he explains this, Loung hears every other word

(out of breath) A Khmer Rouge soldier. They caught him. (Pointing) They are taking him up there. Kim sits to catch his breath. Loung pulls Chou with her. She wants to see. Chou resists Loung heads off on her own.

Loung makes her way towards the sound until she closes in a mob of people.  81. Their bodies block her view of the prisoner. She tries to shift her body to find an open space but she cannot. Frustrated, she wedges her small body between theirs and pushes her way through. She is in the middle of the crowd surrounded by people. She cannot see anything. She looks to the faces of the adults who are all looking in the sam direction. Some are staring at him overwhelmed with emoti unable to speak. Some are full of rage. Finally, she sees a clearing between people's legs. She t to push her way through, but they are so engrossed in wha going on that they do not move. Determined, she gets on h hands and knees, and crawls through the brown forest of l up to the front. There he is. Loung stands and finds herself almost face-t face with him, separated by only ten feet. Automatically, raises her scarf to cover her head and face. Her heart be wildly. Fear seeps into her body. She peeks over her scar He is looking at her. She takes a step back, leaning into the crowd for protect The crowd vibrates with anticipation and energy, closing around the prisoner. LoungвЂ™s hands close into fists. The mans face reveals nothing. His lips do not beg for me He sits propped up on a high back chair on a gravel hill serves as a stage. He is dark and wears the black clothes the Khmer Rouge. A rough hemp rope that binds his feet together. More rope straps him to the back of the chair, coils around him from the chest down to the stomach.

Murderer! Loung stares at him full of hatred. Loung watches as sweat streams down his adams apple. He b his head, looks down at his feet again, knowing there is way out. Many people are wailing and accusing the man of killing t loved ones. Begging him to answer for his crimes. A WOMAN, crying loudly, pushes her way to the front of th crowd. She is young, in her mid twenties. Like Loung, she wears the Khmer Rouge clothes. Though tears fall from her eyes, her face is angry.

(shaking with emotion) I know this soldier. He killed my husband and my sons. I know this man.  82. Tears in her eyes. In her hand she holds a weapon, its wo handle worn and splintered. Loung no longer listening. Sh fixated on the prisoner. He looks up briefly when the wom comes forth, but now he is back in position, head down, e to the ground. Loung watches as the woman walks up to him, her weapon in hand. She stands in front of him, staring at the top of h head. Loung wants to shield her eyes from what's about to happen, but she canвЂ™t. The woman's hands shake as she r the weapon high above her head. (FLASH OF PA BEING HIT.)

The woman raises her weapon again. The crowd is silenced. An OLDER WOMAN reaches for her to stop her. She pushes he away. A man steps forward angry and is held back by anoth There is pain and chaos. Screaming and tears. Blood splatters the woman's clothes, and face. She scream and swings the weapon up above her head again. (Flash of Loung with a weapon. A surreal moment) Blood droplets lan LoungвЂ™s pants and face as she stands watching. Loung wa as the prisoners leg jerks but is held down by the rope. Khmer Rouge body convulses and trembles, as if electricit traveling to the legs, arms, and fingers. The Older Woman grabs her and holds her. She regains her composure. The Older Woman speaks with passion about how Cambodian people will not be destroyed by this. That she not become hateful like the KR. Then the Woman drops the weapon and they begin to walk aw When they turn around, Loung sees that she looks like dea herself. Her hair trickles blood and sweat, their clothes drip, her face red and rigid. (flash cuts between Loung a the Woman) The Woman is quiet as the crowd parts for her to pass through. Moments later- One by one, people return to their homes, leaving Loung standing there alone, staring at the KR soldier. He looks back at her. LoungвЂ™s fists open. She no longer wants to fight.  83.

text: Finally, Loung cries. She lets it all come out of her. Al the loss. All the pain.

1979 Sun rises over the large camp. Loung watches a young man who was a victim of a land-mine months ago. Now he helps to build a small hut. She is in of his strength and agility with his loss of limbs. She looks around the camp. Some people have already chang into colorful clothes. More plastic tents.

Light rain falls on LoungвЂ™s small frame. Still in her o black pants, she wears a new colorful shirt. Her hair is longer. She balls up a handful of rice and rolls it into a banana leaf. She walks over to a woman sleeping alone under anot tree. A small child lay nearby. She lays it down in front her as a silent gift.

Like in the opening she walks and sees her reflection. Th time in the pond. She walks on towards a tree. She climbs a tree. She looks across the camp. She looks down at her feet. So much has changed since her days in Phnom Penh. Loung hears Kim and looks up. She sees Kim walking toward her with two men. Afraid, she jumps down and takes a step back. She canвЂ™t see clearly. Chou is also staring at the men. they comes closer they realize it is Meng and Khouy! Chou runs to them and jumps into KhouyвЂ™s arms. Loung fi herself feeling shy, and stands stiff and awkward. Meng kneels before her. He smiles and musses her hair just lik he used to. Her heart soars quickly at the touch of his hand. He is real - not a figment of her imagination!  84. Her brothers are alive. The five remaining members of the family embrace each other. They have survived. We hold on LoungвЂ™s face. She smiles.
